title: What Is The Role Of Diksa Guru In ISKCON? | His Grace Suvyakta Narasimha Dasa
speaker: HG Suvyakta Narasimha Dasa

segments.key_quote: In 1978, after Srila Prabhupada's disappearance, the GBC of Vizcon decided to implement an unauthorized guru system by elevating 11 devotees as zonal acharyas and diksha gurus, declaring that they had overnight become pure devotees.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the topic by discussing the unauthorized guru system implemented in ISKCON after Srila Prabhupada's disappearance and the subsequent fall of many gurus.
segments.transcript: Hare Krishna! Vishwaguru Srila Prabhupada ki Jai! In 1978, after Srila Prabhupada's disappearance, the GBC of ISKCON decided to implement an unauthorized guru system by elevating 11 devotees as zonal acharyas and diksha gurus, declaring that they had overnight become pure devotees. Over the years, this unauthorized guru system has failed the devotees, with almost 75 gurus falling from grace till date.

segments.key_quote: In the year 1999, the GBC passed Resolution No. 405, titled Standards of Guru Worship in ISKCON, and the GBC made it into a law in ISKCON.
segments.summary: The speaker discusses GBC Resolution No. 405, which mandates daily guru puja for Srila Prabhupada for all devotees in ISKCON.
segments.transcript: In reaction to the constant guru fall-downs, the GBC has been chopping and changing the unauthorized guru system as well as their understanding of the functions, qualifications, and characteristics. In the year 1999, the GBC passed Resolution No. 405, titled Standards of Guru Worship in ISKCON, and the GBC made it into a law in ISKCON. It has become an ISKCON law. As part of this ISKCON law, the GBC resolved, under subsection C of this Resolution No. 405, in order to offer appropriate respect to Srila Prabhupada as founder acharya and pre-eminent spiritual master of ISKCON. It is considered an essential devotional practice for all ISKCON devotees to observe or perform Srila Prabhupada's guru puja daily, either in an ISKCON temple or, if not possible, in one's home. So, the GBC made it mandatory for all devotees in ISKCON, irrespective of who was their diksha guru, to perform guru puja for Srila Prabhupada daily, either in the temple or at home.

segments.key_quote: That Srila Prabhupada is the sole Diksha Guru for ISKCON.
segments.summary: The speaker concludes that Srila Prabhupada is the sole Diksha Guru for ISKCON, advocating for the implementation of the Ritvik system of initiations and urging devotees to follow Srila Prabhupada's July 9th order.
segments.transcript: Diksha Gurus are eternally the Diksha Gurus for their disciples or not. So, it is unclear. When it comes to the next point from the Srimad Bhagavatam, 4th Canto, 21st verse, Chapter 31 purport, as Krishna takes away all the sinful reactions of a person immediately upon his surrender unto Him, similarly, the external manifestation of Krishna, the representative personality of Godhead takes all the resultant actions of the sinful life of the disciple immediately after the disciple's initiation. And in the Sri Guru Vandana, the devotee has to sing to Srila Prabhupada, Sri Guru Karuna Sindhu, Adama Janara Bandhu. The spiritual master is an ocean of mercy, the friend of the poor. So, Prabhupada is the mercy incarnation of Krishna and it fulfils this criterion. And as far as the GBC is concerned, they have said that the gurus, the diksha gurus in ISKCON are not pure devotees. They don't have any specific state of realization. So, are they taking the sinful reactions of the disciples? It is unclear. They are saying that some of the diksha gurus, they claim that they are taking it. Some of the diksha gurus are claiming it is Prabhupada who takes. Some of them say that how can we burden Srila Prabhupada with the sins of our disciples and all kinds of opinions exist in ISKCON on this front. And so, it is unclear who is taking the sinful reactions of the disciples. So, when we look at this table, there is only one positive thing that the unauthorized diksha gurus in ISKCON are doing. What is it? They are giving diksha. So, apart from giving so-called diksha, what are the diksha gurus in ISKCON doing? There may be 100 plus devotees calling themselves diksha gurus, but none of them perform any of the functions of a diksha guru described in Sri Guru Vandana sung for Srila Prabhupada daily. And nor do any of them fulfill any of the quotes of Srila Prabhupada on diksha guru on initiating guru. So, ultimately, even if you go by these GBC resolutions, an intelligent and well-informed devotee can come to only one conclusion. And what is that? That Srila Prabhupada is the sole Diksha Guru for ISKCON. And that is what Srila Prabhupada too confirmed in the July 9th, 1977 order to all temple presidents and GBCs that he is the spiritual master, he is the Diksha Guru and everybody who takes initiation in ISKCON are his disciples even after his disappearance. So, without getting confused, please follow the July 9th order of Srila Prabhupada implementing the Ritvik system of initiations in ISKCON and accept Srila Prabhupada as the sole Diksha Guru in ISKCON through this Ritvik system of initiations and do not be misled by the unauthorized Guru system in ISKCON. Hare Krishna, Vishwa Guru, Srila Prabhupada ki Jai.
